meanings.definition: To march faster or farther than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers tried to outmarch their rivals to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The hikers were determined to outmarch the storm and make it back to camp before dark.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident that he could outmarch his speedy opponent.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outmarch any obstacles in her path propelled her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner's goal was to outmarch her personal best time and set a new record.

meanings.sent1: In the military competition, the elite unit managed to outmarch all other teams.
meanings.sent2: The champion athlete was able to outmarch his opponents in every race he entered.
meanings.sent3: The ants' ability to outmarch other insects in search of food amazed the observers.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outmarch his own limitations led him to achieve great success.
meanings.sent5: The team's synchronized movements allowed them to outmarch their rivals with ease.
